snippet: Angela B. Corey, who was appointed special prosecutor in the killing of Trayvon Martin, must alone determine whether to charge the man who shot the unarmed teenager.
abstract: Angela B Corey, special prosecutor appointed to investigate shooting death of Trayvon Martin, says the case will not go to a grand jury; Corey alone must determine whether to file charges against George Zimmerman, neighborhood watch volunteer who shot and killed the unarmed Florida teenager, or to drop the case, in which many facts are in dispute and no witnesses have come forward publicly.

byline.original: By LIZETTE ALVAREZ and JOHN SCHWARTZ

lead_paragraph: Angela B. Corey, who was appointed special prosecutor in the killing of Trayvon Martin, must alone determine whether to charge the man who shot the unarmed teenager.

headline.seo: Grand Jury Review Skipped in Trayvon Martin Case
headline.main: Prosecutor in Martin Case Will Alone Determine Its Merits
headline.print_headline: For Prosecutor, Making a Call In Martin Case
